page.title: 03SEDGEBROOK FARM - BRAMPTON
page.content: SEDGEBROOK IS A FAMILY RUN FARM WHICH COVERS A CONSIDERABLE PORTION OF OUR SURVEY AREA. MR. WILLIAM COWLEY, HIS WIFE AND SONS CONCENTRATE MOSTLY ON ANIMALS WITH ONLY A FEW CROPS GROWN AS WINTER FEED FOR THE LIVESTOCK. THERE ARE SEVERAL DOMESTIC ANIMALS KEPT AS PETS AROUND THE FARM BUT THE BUSINESS SIDE CONCENTRATES MAINLY ON SHEEP WITH A FEW BEEF CATTLE. LIFE ON THE FARM INVOLVES LONG WORKING HOURS AND MUCH PHYSICAL LABOUR BUT IS AMPLY REWARDED BY THE TREMENDOUS AMOUNT OF JOB SATISFACTION. THE FAMILY RISES EARLY IN THE MORNING, HAS A HEARTY BREAKFAST OF CEREALS, EGG AND BACON, TOAST AND MARMALADE, PLUS A CUP OF COFFEE. THE ANIMALS HAVE TO BE FED BEFORE THE DAILY CHORES ARE TACKLED AND NORMALLY THEY ARE SETTLED LAST, AT THE END OF A BUSY DAY WHATEVER THE WEATHER.
